meanings.definition: A horizontal beam or bar used to support the mast of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The crosstree held up the tall mast on the ship.
meanings.sent2: Sailors secured the rigging to the crosstree at the top of the mast.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the crosstree and watched the sailors work.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like a crosstree across the calm sea.
meanings.sent5: The crosstree stood strong against the force of the wind, a symbol of stability.

meanings.definition: A horizontal bar or beam that crosses another, especially one at the top of a mast to spread rigging.
meanings.sent1: The crosstree intersected with the mast, creating a sturdy structure.
meanings.sent2: The ropes were neatly arranged on the crosstree for efficient sailing.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat climbed the crosstree and balanced precariously on top.
meanings.sent4: His words intertwined like a crosstree, connecting different ideas seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight danced on the crosstree, casting intricate shadows on the deck.
